member.name: T:FluentRest.DictionaryExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for dictionary

member.name: M:FluentRest.DictionaryExtensions.GetOrAdd``2(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,``1},``0,System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Adds a key/value pair to the dictionary if the key does not already exist.
member.typeparam: The type of the keys in the dictionary.
The type of the values in the dictionary.
member.param: The key of the element to add.
The function used to generate a value for the key.
member.returns: The value for the key. This will be either the existing value for the key if the key is already in the dictionary, or the new value for the key as returned by valueFactory if the key was not in the dictionary.

member.name: M:FluentRest.DictionaryExtensions.TryAdd``2(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,``1},``0,``1)
member.summary: Attempts to add the specified key and value to the Dictionary.
member.param: The dictionary to perform an action upon.
The key of the element to add.
The value of the element to add.
member.returns: true if the key/value pair was added to the Dictionary successfully. If the key already exists, this method returns false.

member.name: M:FluentRest.DictionaryExtensions.TryRemove``2(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,``1},``0,``1@)
member.summary: Attempts to remove and return the value with the specified key from the Dictionary.
member.param: The Dictionary to perform an action upon.
The key of the element to remove and return.
When this method returns, value contains the object removed from the Dictionary or the default value if the operation failed.
member.returns: true if an object was removed successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:FluentRest.DictionaryExtensions.TryUpdate``2(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,``1},``0,``1,``1)
member.summary: Compares the existing value for the specified key with a specified value, and if they are equal, updates the key with a third value.
member.param: The dictionary to perform an action upon.
The key whose value is compared with comparisonValue and possibly replaced.
The value that replaces the value of the element with key if the comparison results in equality.
The value that is compared to the value of the element with key.
member.returns: true if the value with key was equal to comparisonValue and replaced with newValue; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Thrown if key is a null reference

member.name: T:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders
member.summary: Contains the standard set of headers applicable to an HTTP request.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Accept
member.summary: Content-Types that are acceptable

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.AcceptCharset
member.summary: Character sets that are acceptable

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.AcceptEncoding
member.summary: Acceptable encodings. See HTTP compression.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.AcceptLanguage
member.summary: Acceptable languages for response

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.AcceptDatetime
member.summary: Acceptable version in time

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Authorization
member.summary: Authentication credentials for HTTP authentication

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.CacheControl
member.summary: Used to specify directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms along the request/response chain

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Connection
member.summary: What type of connection the user-agent would prefer

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Cookie
member.summary: an HTTP cookie previously sent by the server with Set-Cookie (below)

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the request body in octets (8-bit bytes)

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.ContentM5
member.summary: A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the request body

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.ContentType
member.summary: The MIME type of the body of the request (used with POST and PUT requests)

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The content encoding

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Date
member.summary: The date and time that the message was sent

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Expect
member.summary: Indicates that particular server behaviors are required by the client

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.From
member.summary: The email address of the user making the request

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Host
member.summary: The domain name of the server (for virtual hosting), mandatory since HTTP/1.1. Although domain name are specified as case-insensitive[5][6], it is not specified whether the contents of the Host field should be interpreted in a case-insensitive manner[7] and in practice some implementations of virtual hosting interpret the contents of the Host field in a case-sensitive manner.[citation needed]

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.IfMatch
member.summary: Only perform the action if the client supplied entity matches the same entity on the server. This is mainly for methods like PUT to only update a resource if it has not been modified since the user last updated it.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.IfModifiedSince
member.summary: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.IfNoneMatch
member.summary: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, see HTTP ETag

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.IfRange
member.summary: If the entity is unchanged, send me the part(s) that I am missing; otherwise, send me the entire new entity

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.IfUnmodifiedSince
member.summary: Only send the response if the entity has not been modified since a specific time.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.MaxForwards
member.summary: Limit the number of times the message can be forwarded through proxies or gateways.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Pragma
member.summary: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.ProxyAuthorization
member.summary: Authorization credentials for connecting to a proxy.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Range
member.summary: Request only part of an entity. Bytes are numbered from 0.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Referer
member.summary: This is the address of the previous web page from which a link to the currently requested page was followed. (The word referrer is misspelled in the RFC as well as in most implementations.)

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.TE
member.summary: The transfer encodings the user agent is willing to accept: the same values as for the response header Transfer-Encoding can be used, plus the trailers value (related to the chunked transfer method) to notify the server it expects to receive additional headers (the trailers) after the last, zero-sized, chunk.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Upgrade
member.summary: Ask the server to upgrade to another protocol.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent string of the user agent

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Via
member.summary: Informs the server of proxies through which the request was sent.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.Warning
member.summary: A general warning about possible problems with the entity body.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpRequestHeaders.MethodOverride
member.summary: Used to specify an HTTP method override value.

member.name: T:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders
member.summary: Contains the standard set of headers applicable to an HTTP response.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.AcceptRanges
member.summary: What partial content range types this server supports

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Age
member.summary: The age the object has been in a proxy cache in seconds

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Allow
member.summary: Valid actions for a specified resource. To be used for a 405 Method not allowed

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.CacheControl
member.summary: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Connection
member.summary: Options that are desired for the connection[17]

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The type of encoding used on the data. See HTTP compression.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ContentLanguage
member.summary: The language the content is in

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ContentLocation
member.summary: An alternate location for the returned data

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ContentMD5
member.summary: A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the response

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ContentDisposition
member.summary: An opportunity to raise a File Download dialogue box for a known MIME type with binary format or suggest a filename for dynamic content. Quotes are necessary with special characters.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ContentRange
member.summary: Where in a full body message this partial message belongs

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ContentType
member.summary: The MIME type of this content

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Date
member.summary: The date and time that the message was sent

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ETag
member.summary: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Expires
member.summary: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.LastModified
member.summary: The last modified date for the requested object, inRFC 2822 format

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Link
member.summary: Used to express a typed relationship with another resource, where the relation type is defined by RFC 5988

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Location
member.summary: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.P3P
member.summary: This header is supposed to set P3P policy, in the form of P3P:CP=your_compact_policy. However, P3P did not take off,[22] most browsers have never fully implemented it, a lot of websites set this header with fake policy text, that was enough to fool browsers the existence of P3P policy and grant permissions for third party cookies.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Pragma
member.summary: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.ProxyAuthenticate
member.summary: Request authentication to access the proxy.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Refresh
member.summary: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created. This refresh redirects after 5 seconds. This is a proprietary, non-standard header extension introduced by Netscape and supported by most web browsers.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.RetryAfter
member.summary: If an entity is temporarily unavailable, this instructs the client to try again after a specified period of time (seconds).

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Server
member.summary: A name for the server

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.SetCookie
member.summary: an HTTP cookie

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.StrictTransportSecurity
member.summary: A HTTPS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Trailer
member.summary: The Trailer general field value indicates that the given set of header fields is present in the trailer of a message encoded with chunked transfer-coding.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.TransferEncoding
member.summary: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are:chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

member.name: F:FluentRest.HttpResponseHeaders.Vary
member.summary: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.
